channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large fly-tip of mixed rubbish and furniture in alleyway, blocking access and causing smell and pest risk, 5th February
item.description:
This rubbish has been building up for 1–2 years and has not been cleared. In the past few months it has grown significantly, with more and more waste being dumped. The pile is getting larger, starting to smell, and attracting pests. It is now a public health concern and needs urgent removal.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 99, High Street, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Every day dog fouling, 5th February
item.description:
There is dog fouling here regularly, I have had to pick up the fouling. Owners are not all taking responsibility to clean up after their pets. Kids stepping into the fouling. You need to put a sign up on the lamppost ASAP for Pet Owner Awareness, this is not hygienic. To Note: In the Royal Borough of Greenwich, dog owners must immediately clean up after their pets in all public spaces, enforced borough-wide by a Public Spaces Protection Order (PSPO). Failure to do so risks a £100 fixed penalty notice or fines up to £1,000 via prosecution, with reports handled via FixMyStreet. Key Rules & Enforcement Immediate Cleanup: You must pick up dog waste immediately, regardless of location (parks, pavements, residential areas). Penalties: £100 Fixed Penalty Notice (FPN). Potential prosecution with fines up to £1,000. No Excuses: Not having a bag or being unaware the dog fouled is not a valid defense. PSPO Coverage: The rules are enforced borough-wide under a Public Spaces Protection Order (PSPO), which also covers dog exclusion zones and leads on request. What needs to be actioned on the lampost: Process: Reports are passed to street services, and areas with significant issues can be monitored or get extra signage. Action: The sign needs to be implemented to increase awareness urgently.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Manton Road, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet
